QSPI Driver External Functions

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the driver.

Function Documentation

int32_t QSPI_cfgRead ( QSPI_Handle  handle,
QSPI_CMD  cmd,
QSPI_WORDLEN  wordLen,
uint32_t *  data,
uint32_t  numWords 
)

Description
This function Performs a QSPI read through configuration port.

Parameters
[in]handleQSPI handle
[in]cmdQSPI read command
[in]wordLenQSPI data word length in number of bits
[in]dataPointer to a data buffer to save the read data
[in]numWordsNumber of Words to be read in a frame
Return values
Success=0; Faliure <0 value indicates the error code
int32_t QSPI_cfgWrite ( QSPI_Handle  handle,
QSPI_CMD  cmd,
QSPI_WORDLEN  wordLen,
uint32_t  data,
uint32_t  numWords 
)

Description
This function Performs a QSPI write through configuration port.

Parameters
[in]handleQSPI handle
[in]cmdQSPI write command
[in]wordLenQSPI data word length in number of bits
[in]dataData to be written
[in]numWordsNumber of Words to be written in a frame
Return values
Success=0; Faliure <0 value indicates the error code
void QSPI_init ( void  )

Description
This function must be called once per system and before any other QSPI driver APIs.

Return values
Notapplicable
bool QSPI_isBusy ( QSPI_Handle  handle)

Description
This function polls the status of QSPI busy bit

Parameters
[in]handleQSPI handle
Return values
trueQSPI is in busy state false QSPI is in free state
bool QSPI_isFrameCompleted ( QSPI_Handle  handle)

Description
This function polls the status of frame transfer complete

Parameters
[in]handleQSPI handle
Return values
trueFrame transfer completed false Frame transfer is not completed
void QSPI_memAccessCfg ( QSPI_Handle  handle,
QSPI_memConfig *  memConfig 
)

Description
This function configurates memory map setup register

Parameters
[in]handleQSPI handle
[in]memConfigmemory map configuration
Return values
Success=0; Faliure <0 value indicates the error code
void QSPI_Params_init ( QSPI_Params *  params)

Description
This function must be called once per system and before any other QSPI driver APIs.

Parameters
[in]paramsQSPI params for creating a instance for the first time
Return values
Notapplicable
